alert.note: Alert for Franklin, Eastern Oneida Region; Marsh and Arbon Highlands (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 4:32PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Oneida, central Bannock and southeastern Power Counties through 530 PM MDT... At 430 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles east of Fort Hall Bannock Peak, or 15 miles southwest of McCammon, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Moderate rain, wind gusts to 40 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Moderate rain passing over a region with previous heavy rain may produce notable increases in runoff in normally dry washes or gullies. Locations impacted include... Hawkins Reservoir, Pauline and Mink Creek Pass. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Franklin, Eastern Oneida Region; Marsh and Arbon Highlands
